name: Thinker Relationship Network - Phase 3
description: Complete thinker-to-thinker relationship graph showing who influenced whom
overview: This file maps intellectual influences and relationships between thinkers, extracted from related_thinkers arrays in the Master 4500 dataset

relationship_types.description: Direct intellectual influence - B influenced A's thinking

example.context: Primary collaborator on prospect theory and decision-making research
Co-authors of foundational behavioral economics research

relationship_types.description: Indirect influence through ideas or frameworks (inferred)

extraction_rules.direct_relationships: Extracted from related_thinkers arrays in master_4500 table

relationship_strength.strong: Explicitly listed as primary influence or frequent collaborator
relationship_strength.medium: Listed in related_thinkers but not primary influence
relationship_strength.weak: Indirect connection through shared frameworks or fields

extraction_rules.bidirectional_inference: If A lists B and B lists A, mark as bidirectional collaboration
extraction_rules.transitive_inference: If A influenced B (strong) and B influenced C (strong), infer weak A->C connection

behavioral_economics_cluster.context: Primary research collaboration on heuristics and biases
Bounded rationality concept influenced dual-process theory
Prospect theory shaped nudge theory and behavioral economics applications
Built on behavioral economics frameworks for irrationality research
Alternative perspective on heuristics - fast and frugal rather than biased

systems_thinking_cluster.context: Student of Forrester, expanded system dynamics to leverage points
Built learning organizations concept on systems thinking foundations

ai_ethics_cluster.context: Co-authors of AI: A Modern Approach textbook
AI ethics and fairness research informed by alignment concerns
Deep learning pioneers and co-recipients of Turing Award

most_influential_thinkers.description: Thinkers with highest in-degree (most others cite them as influences)

most_collaborative_thinkers.characteristics: High collaboration intensity, often team-based research

isolated_thinkers.note: May be contemporary/emerging thinkers or data gaps

query_patterns_enabled.method: Find all edges where source='kahneman-daniel' and type='influenced_by'
Find all edges where target='simon-herbert' and type='influenced_by'

query_patterns_enabled.query: What is the intellectual path from Turing to LeCun?
query_patterns_enabled.method: Find shortest path in directed graph from turing-alan to lecun-yann
Traverse influenced_by edges from kahneman-daniel to depth 2-3
Filter bidirectional edges where both nodes have tag='behavioral-economics'

integration_with_other_files.01-tag-mapping: Use tags to identify intellectual clusters and communities
integration_with_other_files.03-technological-eras: Show how influence patterns changed across eras
integration_with_other_files.14-framework-connections: Connect thinker relationships to framework development
integration_with_other_files.master_4500_records: Source data for all thinker relationships

2. Create edges for each relationship with source and target IDs

5. Calculate network statistics (degree centrality, betweenness, clustering)
6. Generate community detection for intellectual clusters
7. Export as graph JSON with nodes and edges arrays
usage_note: This file structure defines the relationship network format. Actual relationship data should be extracted from Master 4500 records once Phase 2 export is complete.
